report.title: Vivid Colours
report.author: S
report.bodytext: The descriptions online are a little disconcerting, but I saw a friend do it, so I figured I would give it a try. /n /n First try we went really low with the CO2, around 10-15%. Colours became more vivid, I fealt slightly disorientated. I fealt slightly weird afterwards, so I waited about 2 hours before trying again. /n /n We did a more accurate mix for the 30% mark, and I began sucking it down. Breathing out through the nose, it had that acidic tang that you get if you smell the top of a recently opened soda. I can understand where people would get the idea of panicing if they just lost it when the breathing became difficult. It does feel funny, because I want to exhale as soon as I get the mix in my lungs. But I remind myself to go with it, there's a lot of O2 there. Colours go vivid, then sort of explode. /n /n Aftereffects (acquard feelings, difficulty communicating, sense of unreality) last about 5 minutes for the real feelings, and about a half hour for the psychological effects. /n /n We like thoughtful and tactile experiences, this is neither, I also don't know if I'd do it again... but it wasn't bad.
